oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Making the right culling decisions on the dairy: Helping young veterinarians advocate for their patients and prevent animal suffering
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Fitchhorn-Walker, Jennifer
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: bovine
animal welfare
culling decisions
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Data indicates that the decision to ship compromised cull cows is too common. Compromised culled dairy cattle continue to arrive at slaughter plants. Leadership within the industry is needed to address this welfare challenge. Dairy cattle veterinarians are uniquely positioned to and responsible for meeting this task. It is supposed by the author that while the next generation of cattle veterinarians are also uniquely qualified to deliver meaningful progress, there is no secret weapon, treatment or single answer that will deliver success; merely one simple ingredient, compassion.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2021 Recent Graduate Proceedings ; 49-50
